definition:
to, toward, or in the south                                      
             
             a house facing south

into a state of decline or ruin                                      
             
             causes the sluggish economy to go south

situated toward or at the south                                      
             
             the south entrance

coming from the south                                      
             
             a south wind
the direction of the south terrestrial pole : the direction to the right of one facing east
the compass point directly opposite to north
regions or countries lying to the south of a specified or implied point of orientation
the right side of a church looking toward the altar from the nave
the one of four positions at 90-degree intervals that lies to the south or at the bottom of a diagram
a person (such as a bridge player) occupying this position in the course of a specified activity
the developing nations of the world : third world sense 1  — compare north sense 2b
Robert 1634–1716 English clergyman
to or toward the south
into a worse state or condition
located in or toward the south
coming from the south
the direction that is to your right when you are facing the rising sun : the direction that is the opposite of north
regions or countries south of a certain point

to or toward the south                                      
             
             The cabin faces south.

placed toward, facing, or coming from the south                                      
             
             a south wind
the direction to the right of someone facing east : the compass point opposite to north
regions or countries south of a point that is mentioned or understood
in: a house facing south
causes the sluggish economy to go south
the south entrance
a south wind

definition: the direction that is on your right when you are facing the rising sun and is usually on the bottom of a map
the part of a country or place that is in this direction
in: driving from south to north
Their business is in the south of the city.
Did you like living in the south?

definition: the direction that goes towards the part of the earth below the equator, opposite to the north, or the part of an area or country that is in this direction:
the southern states of the US:
the developing countries of the world, most of which are below the equator
in or forming the south part of something:
a wind coming from the south
towards the south:
to or in the south of a country or region:
(in or to) England, when considered in relation to Scotland
(in or to) Mexico and the other countries south of the US border with Mexico, when considered in relation to the US
the direction opposite north, or the part of an area or country in this direction:
In the US, the South is the southeastern part of the country:
In the US Civil War, the South was the group of states that fought to become separate from the federal government.
in, forming, or toward the south part of something:
in: The points of the compass are north, south, east, and west.
The best beaches are in the south (of the island).
We spent our holiday in the south of France.
Canberra is/lies to the south of Sydney.

He travelled due (= directly) south, towards the desert.
Alice got a job down south.
We moved to the South when I was a child.
a southerly direction
Louisiana is in the southern part of the US.
The University is on the south side of town.

1. lower regions of a designated person, place or thing

2. term used to refer to the lower, warmer states in the USA; most are known for having played roles in the Civil War. Often times the people are stereotyped as being closed minded bigots or inbreeding cultural deficient folk. THIS IS A LIE! Southerners are renowned for their hospitallity though this is not true for all. Yes, most of the Southern states played a part in the pro-slave side of the Civil War but people today are more open-minded and educated. People of today can not be blamed for events beyond their control. Also fabled for greasy, salty fattening foods. I need only point out to a northern McDonalds to prove that this is a common misconception although we do make pretty good fried chicken.

3. the south pole

The South is Texas, Mississippi, Louisiana, Alabama, Georgia, North Carolina, South Carolina, Virginia, Tennessee, Arkansas and sometimes Florida and Oklahoma. Texas is especially the South cause we embrace our Southernness without shame. The South rules.
